text: Jack White (born Horst Nu√übaum, 2 September 1940) is a German music composer and producer and former football player. White was born in Cologne, Germany. Among the songs he produced or co-produced for the international market were Laura Branigan's "Gloria" (1982), "Solitaire" (1983), "How Am I Supposed To Live Without You" (1983), "Self-Control" (1984) and "The Lucky One" (1984), as well as Jermaine Jackson's and Pia Zadora's "When the Rain Begins to Fall" (1984). ==References== Category:1940 births Category:Living people Category:German footballers Category:German songwriters Category:20th-century German composers Category:German record producers Category:People from Cologne Category:21st-century German composers
title: Jack White (music producer)
